title: Easy Crispy Baked Chicken Recipe
description: This crispy baked chicken recipe uses seasoned crushed saltine crackers to make an easy crust for baked chicken that bakes up golden and crunchy.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Never lose a recipe: Join MyRecipes to save and find favorites from AR & beyond Recipes Meat and Poultry Chicken Chicken Breast Easy Crispy Baked Chicken 4.6 (203) 182 Reviews 32 Photos This crispy baked chicken recipe is an easy way to have the texture of fried chicken but with baking. Submitted by Gail Updated on March 8, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 32 32 32 32 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 45 mins Total Time: 1 hr Servings: 6 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings 2 cups crushed saltine crackers 1 teaspoon seasoned salt 1 pinch garlic powder, or to taste 6 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves ½ cup margarine, melted Directions Gather all ingredients and preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Grease a large baking dish. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Mix together crushed crackers, seasoned salt, and garlic powder in a shallow bowl. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Dip chicken breasts into melted margarine, then press into cracker mixture until coated. Arrange chicken in the prepared baking dish. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Bake in the preheated oven until chicken breasts are no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, 45 to 60 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (75 degrees C). Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Serve and enjoy! Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Editor's Note: The nutrition data for this recipe includes the full amount of the breading ingredients. The actual amount of the breading consumed will vary. I Made It Print 584 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Easy Crispy Baked Chicken 01 of 32 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 32 Photo by  Billie Simmons 12/12/2024 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Crowd-pleaser Family favorite Just made this for dinner and let me tell you... it was delicious!! The family loved it!! Very easy to make. Only thing I will change next time is the crackers. It was salty for my liking but still good. 03 of 32 Photo by  Hurley 04/09/2022 This recipe was a good find we used one sleeve of saltine crackers and we used regular butter not margarine to coat the chicken and my husband pushed the cracker mix into the chicken sure it’s Coated/we baked it for about 45 minutes and it came out great!!! 04 of 32 Photo by  Lisa Canning 01/11/2022 05 of 32 Photo by  Valerie Bissell 04/15/2021 This tasted great. I made it according to the recipe although I made a smaller batch. Well I complaint is it definitely does not need to cook that long. I pulled it out early and it was still dry. Now I will know for next time. 06 of 32 Photo by  Jylian Leigh 01/16/2021 07 of 32 Photo by  Nikki Pilot 07/23/2020 08 of 32 Photo by  Leona Maupin 03/26/2020 Love this delicious recipe and so easy to make. It was just a little salty. I am single so I cook for 1. I chunked a large breast and cooked only 25 minutes. It turned out great. 09 of 32 Photo by  Hannah Andronic 05/17/2019 10 of 32 Photo by  ChiChefJoe 01/31/2019 1 2 3 4 Next You’ll Also Love Easy Chicken Breast Wrapped in Bacon 32 Ratings Balsamic Goat Cheese Stuffed Chicken Breasts 112 Ratings Chicken and Rice Casserole 26 Ratings Baked Ranch Chicken 73 Ratings One-Pan Chicken Dinner 88 Ratings Simply Parmesan Chicken 470 Ratings Feta Chicken 741 Ratings Panko Buffalo Chicken Tenders 6 Ratings Cashew Crusted Chicken 334 Ratings Sheet Pan Chicken Meal 20 Ratings Basic Broiled Chicken Breasts 117 Ratings Honey Flaked Chicken 49 Ratings Parmesan Sesame Chicken 54 Ratings Keto Chicken Taco Shells 9 Ratings Easy Company Chicken 108 Ratings Easy Baked Chicken Tenders 75 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
